item.description:
Hi Everyone,
This is actually a Boston Vegetarian Society dinning out event that happens to be in Bedford at The Flatbread Company!
This place is great and they have vegan pizza listed on the menu!
Itâ€™s this Tuesday the 21st - I apologize for the short notice.
Please see details below:

Dear Boston Vegetarian Society,

We're having another event that is convenient for our friends to the
Northwest!

Let's get to know each other over some chewy gourmet flatbreads piled with
organic veggies. A portion of $ from each delicious pizza goes to the rabbit
rescue and adoption efforts of the House Rabbit Network (HRN).

(Note: Several of our members volunteer with HRN. HRN arranged the benefit and
we're giving it an extra boost with this event. $3.50 from each large/$1.75
from each small flatbread we order will go to HRN!)


TUESDAY, OCTOBER 21, 2008
5:30 - 8:30 PM (arrive whenever you can)

The Flatbread Company
213 Burlington Road
Bedford MA
(781) 275-8200
Read directions at bottom.


The Flatbread Company uses organic produce and is on the Phantom Gourmet's
"8 Favorite Restaurants of All-Time" list for their fabulous
flatbreads wood-fired in a clay oven right in the dining room. "The
exceptional, free-form crust is made from wheat, cake yeast, and spring water,
resulting in awesome chewiness and slim structure," says the Phantom.


Listed on their menu of pizzas:

Vegan Pizza - Our organic wood-fired cauldron tomato sauce, organic caramelized
onions, organic
mushrooms, Kalamata olives and homemade organic garlic oil with our own blend
of organic herbs
Whole $14.50, Small $7.75

You can also add-on organic veggies from their list: Fire-roasted red peppers,
organic red onions, Kalamata olives, sulfate-free organic sun-dried tomatoes,
organic mushrooms, organic rosemary, organic herb mix, wood-fired cauldron
tomato sauce

Also on their menu is a highly acclaimed salad -- no $ from this goes to the
bunny benefit, but it's a great side dish to your pizza:
Organic mesclun and organic sweet leaf lettuces tossed with organic celery and
carrots, toasted sesame seeds, organic Arame seaweed and homemade berry
vinaigrette $6.00

About Bunnies:

They can be wonderful companions for a vegetarian household! Rabbits are
natural vegetarians, can be litterbox trained, and can make joyful, affectionate
housemates. Shelters and rescue groups are full of domestic rabbits needing
their "forever home." Thinking about adoption? Learn more from the
experts at HRN, who will be present at this event:
http://www.rabbitnetw...

DIRECTIONS:

Flatbread Co. is in a complex of buildings that looks like an office park.
Also in that complex are Bamboo and The Melting Pot, and you can see their signs
from the road. (It is across Rt. 62 from MITRE Corp.)

From Rt. 128 take Exit 32 onto Rt. 3 North towards Lowell.
Drive 4/10 mile and take Exit 26 (Rt. 62 Burlington/Bedford); turn right off
the ramp onto Burlington Rd. (Rt. 62 East)
Drive 3/10 mile and turn right at the second light into the parking lot at
Network Drive.

Hope to see you then!

Evelyn Kimber
Boston Vegetarian Society
www.BostonVeg.org
617-424-8846
